question.title: How to read the source code of a Maven dependency's JAR?
question.body:
I'm writing a Maven plugin that parses the source code of the project where this plugin is called, and generates documentation based on certain rules.

Now I have a question: when I have the source code of class A (including its comments) and I found that class A references another class B, how can I get the source code of class B?

Class B may be in the same directory, in a different directory, or even in a Maven dependency's JAR.

Of course, the dependency JAR may have been generated with the maven-source-plugin, in which case I should be able to get its source code, right?

Can anyone give me some ideas or solutions on how to implement this requirement?
